page.title: 09CHURCHES IN LECHLADE CTD..
page.content: {St. Mary's Church,}Buscot, in the diocese of Oxford, was built in the early C13th. It is small and in the countryside. Services are held on the first and third Sundays of the month. The vicar also takes services at Great Coxwell, Coleshill and Eaton Hastings. The Church of St. John the{Baptist, {Inglesham, is a Norman}building with box pews. It is not used any more and is in the care of the Redundant Churches Fund. The Lechlade Churches joined together on May 19th. 1985 for a "Songs Of Praise" service and again in July for a Flower Festival when many of the town clubs displayed flowers in the churches. Regular services are held in the Parish Church by the Primary School. Half of these take the form of a Eucharist.
